chains_details.final_answer_text:
Printer A and Printer B each have a printing rate of 1/2 page per second. When working together, their rates add up. The combined rate is:

\[
\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{2} = 1 \text{ page per second}.
\]

To print 100 pages at this combined rate, the time required is calculated by dividing the total number of pages by the combined rate:

\[
\text{Time} = \frac{100 \text{ pages}}{1 \text{ page/second}} = 100 \text{ seconds}.
\]

The correct answer is **C)100 seconds**.

Answer: C

chains_details.final_answer_text:
To determine how long it will take both printers working together to print 100 pages, first calculate their combined printing rate. Each printer has a rate of \( \frac{1}{2} \) page per second. When combined, their rates add up:

\[
\text{Combined rate} = \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{2} = 1 \text{ page per second}.
\]

The time required to print 100 pages is the total number of pages divided by the combined rate:

\[
\text{Time} = \frac{100 \text{ pages}}{1 \text{ page/second}} = 100 \text{ seconds}.
\]

This matches option C. The other options can be ruled out because they either underestimate or overestimate the combined rate. For instance, if each printer took 200 seconds alone (since \( \frac{1}{2} \) page/second implies 2 seconds per page), working together would halve the time to 100 seconds. Thus, the correct answer is C.

Answer: C

To determine how long it will take both printers working together to print 100 pages, first calculate their combined printing rate. Each printer has a rate of \( \frac{1}{2} \) page per second. When combined, their rates add up:

\[
\text{Combined rate} = \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{2} = 1 \text{ page per second}.
\]

The time required to print 100 pages is the total number of pages divided by the combined rate:

\[
\text{Time} = \frac{100 \text{ pages}}{1 \text{ page/second}} = 100 \text{ seconds}.
\]

This matches option C. The other options can be ruled out because they either underestimate or overestimate the combined rate. For instance, if each printer took 200 seconds alone (since \( \frac{1}{2} \) page/second implies 2 seconds per page), working together would halve the time to 100 seconds. Thus, the correct answer is C.

Answer: C
